title: John Bercow has placed more shackles on Boris Johnson than even Houdini had to endure
text:
In 1913, Harry Houdini attempted the Chinese water torture cell. It involved his ankles being secured in a brace and being lowered, head first, under water in a glass case. He had to escape in full public view.

Our prime minister has been required to pull off a similar stunt, except Boris, unlike Houdini, has had the added complication of being put in a straitjacket by Hilary Benn. Not to mention the obnoxious little hobgoblin who dances atop the watery tomb, as he tries to block any potential escape.

Of all the Brexit Wreckers, I loathe John Bercow most. In general, people have a quiet faith in Parliament. Our democracy is both ancient and stable so we believe that our system is fair. The Speaker...
description: In 1913, Harry Houdini attempted the Chinese water torture cell.
